document.text:
From: Bruce Barket <bbarket@barketepstein.com> 
To:
Cc: Aida Leisenring <aleisenring®barketepstein.com> 
Subject: RE: Quarantine 
Date: 
The, 
01 Sep 2020 20:52:21 +0000 
I just learned that he was being ordered onto another tier, where he does not believe he is safe. Worse, he was told that if 
does not enter the tier where he believes he is in danger he will be sent to SHU. This is deeply troubling. MCC has kept 
Mr. Tartaglione in quarantine for more than twice as long as he was supposed to be there and is now giving him the 
Hobson's choice of SHU or risking his safety. And, his most of his property is still in the old cell where you assured us he 
would be returned. 
I am again asking that he be placed on a safe tier, in a safe cell with a cellmate who does not pose a threat to him, 
preferably the cell where he has been detained for well over a year. 
Bruce A. Barket, Esq. 
Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP 
666 Old Country Road , Ste. 700 
Garden City, NY 11530 
(516) 745 1500 [P] (516) 745 1245 [F] 
www.barketepstein.com 
This transmittal may be a confidential attorney client communication or may otherwise be privileged or confidential. If it is not clear 
that you are the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that you have received this transmittal in error; any review, dissemination, 
distribution or copying of this transmittal is strictly prohibited. If you suspect that you have received this communication in error, 
please notify us immediately by telephone or email and immediately delete this message and all its attachments 
From 
Sent: Tuesday, September 1, 20201:35 PM 
To: Bruce Barket <bbarket@barketepstein.com>; 
Cc: Aida Leisenring <aleisenring@barketepstein.com> 
Subject: Re: Quarantine 
Good afternoon-
It is my understanding that he is not in quarantine. 
>>> 
Bruce Barket <bbarket@barketepstein.com> 
9/1/2020 7:25 
AM 
>>> 
Good morning, 
I understand that Mr. Tartaglione is still in quarantine although he was cleared to return to general population. As I wrote 
over the weekend, apparently the MCC refused to place Mr. Tartaglione back in his cell where he has been safe or in a unit 
of people over few years old. He is a retired police officer. As such he has been and is targeted for violence by other 
inmates. Prior to being housed with his current cellmate, Mr. Tartaglione was assaulted resulting in surgery and an 
extended stay in a hospital. For coming up on two years he has lived in a cell with a cellmate and has been relatively safe. 
He was removed—supposedly for 14 days—over a month ago from that cell and is now being forced to either stay in 
EFTA00032123

quarantine or be placed in a cell with a  new cellmate where he may not be safe. We understood from you that he would 
be returned to the cell where he has lived in relative safety after quarantine. 
Can you please take the steps necessary to make sure Mr. Tartaglione is released from quarantine and placed in a cell that 
is safe? Thank you. 
Bruce A. Barket, Esq. 
Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP 
666 Old Country Road ,  Ste. 700 
Garden City, NY 11530 
(516) 745 1500 [P] (516) 745 1245 [F] 
www.barketepstein.com 
This transmittal may be a confidential attorney client communication or may otherwise be privileged or confidential. If it is not clear 
that you are the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that you have received this transmittal in error; any review, dissemination, 
distribution or copying of this transmittal is strictly prohibited. If you suspect that you have received this communication in error, 
please notify us immediately by telephone or email and immediately delete this message and all its attachments 
EFTA00032124
